name: Extract selected columns of number array (by name)

in_ports.name: column_names
in_ports.hint: [Optional] List of names in the previous array, separated by \n (name of every column in a separate line).

out_ports.name: column_names
out_ports.hint: List of column names in the result array, separated by \n (name of every column in a separate line).

out_ports.name: column_1
out_ports.hint: Column #1 of the result array. (Calculated on demand).

out_ports.name: column_2
out_ports.hint: Column #2 of the result array. (Calculated on demand).

out_ports.hint: Column #16 of the result array. (Calculated on demand).

controls.caption: Extracted column names
controls.name: extractedColumnNames
controls.description:
List of names of columns, which are extracted from the source arrays according the input "column_names". The names in this list must be separated by \n (one name per string). If empty, the result arrays stays not initialized.
Note: you may use here integer numbers in a role of the names. Such "names" are not searched in "column_names" input port. Positive number K=1,2,3... means the column #K of the source array (starting from 1), negative number K means the column #(number_of_columns+1âˆ’K), zero index K=0 is prohibited.
